org.assertj.swing.fixture

Class AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture<S,T extends AbstractButton>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractComponentFixture<S,T,D>
      • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJComponentFixture<S,T,D>
        • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture<S,T,AbstractButtonDriver>
          • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractButtonFixture<S,T>
            • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture<S,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - used to simulate "self types." For more information please read "Emulating 'self types' using Java Generics to simplify fluent API implementation."
    T - the type of AbstractButton that this fixture can manage.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    JComponentFixture<S>, JPopupMenuInvokerFixture, MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>, TextDisplayFixture<S>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JCheckBoxFixture, JRadioButtonFixture, JToggleButtonFixture

    public abstract class AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture<S,T extends AbstractButton>
extends AbstractButtonFixture<S,T>
    Supports functional testing of AbstractButtons that have 2 states ("checked" and "unchecked.")
    Author:
    Alex Ruiz

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture

        public AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture(@Nonnull
                                     Class<S> selfType,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     Robot robot,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     T target)
        Creates a new AbstractButtonFixture.
        Parameters:
        selfType - the "self type."
        target - the JButton to be managed by this fixture.
        robot - performs simulation of user events on the given AbstractButton.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if robot is null.
        NullPointerException - if target is null.

      • AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture

        public AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture(@Nonnull
                                     Class<S> selfType,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     Robot robot,
                                     @Nullable
                                     String buttonName,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     Class<? extends T> type)
        Creates a new AbstractButtonFixture.
        Parameters:
        selfType - the "self type."
        robot - performs simulation of user events on a AbstractButton.
        buttonName - the name of the AbstractButton to find using the given RobotFixture.
        type - the type of the AbstractButton to find using the given Robot.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if robot is null.
        NullPointerException - if type is null.
        ComponentLookupException - if a matching AbstractButton could not be found. Or if more than one matching AbstractButton is found.

      • check

        @Nonnull
public final S check(boolean checked)
        Checks (or unchecks) this fixture's AbstractButton according to the checked parameter.
        Parameters:
        checked - true if the AbstractButton should be checked.
        Returns:
        this fixture.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this fixture's AbstractButton is disabled.
        IllegalStateException - if this fixture's AbstractButton is not showing on the screen.

public final S check()
        Checks (or selects) this fixture's AbstractButton only it is not already checked.
        Returns:
        this fixture.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this fixture's AbstractButton is disabled.
        IllegalStateException - if this fixture's AbstractButton is not showing on the screen.

      • uncheck

        @Nonnull
public final S uncheck()
        Unchecks this fixture's AbstractButton only if it is checked.
        Returns:
        this fixture.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this fixture's AbstractButton is disabled.
        IllegalStateException - if this fixture's AbstractButton is not showing on the screen.

      • requireSelected

        @Nonnull
public final S requireSelected(boolean selected)
        Verifies that this fixture's AbstractButton selection state is equal to the selected parameter.
        Parameters:
        selected - true if the AbstractButton must be selected.
        Returns:
        this fixture.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the AbstractButton managed by this fixture is not selected.
